intro: Aster delectabilis, commonly known as the sweet aster, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its showy, purple to pink flowers bloom in the fall, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
